name: cfloop
description:
Different items are required based on loop type. Items listed
 as required may not be depending on your loop type.
 Loop forms:
 [query] [condition] [index + from + to ] [index + list]
 [collection + item ]

params.name: index
params.description:
Index value. CFML sets it to from value and
 increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to
 value.

params.name: group
params.description: CF10+ and Lucee only. Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a recordset ordered on one or more query columns.

params.name: groupcasesensitive
params.description: Lucee only. Boolean indicating whether to group with regard to case or not. The default value is NO; case is considered while grouping. If the query attribute specifies a query object that was generated by a case-insensitive SQL query, set the groupCaseSensitive attribute to NO to keep the recordset intact.

params.name: startrow
params.description: First row of query that is included in the loop.

params.name: endrow
params.description: Last row of query that is included in the loop.

params.name: list
params.description: A list, variable, or filename; contains a list

params.name: delimiters
params.description: Character(s) that separates items in list

params.name: collection
params.description:
The collection attribute is used with the item attribute.
 often to loop over a structure

params.name: item
params.description:
The item attribute is used with the collection attribute.
 often to loop over a structure

params.name: characters
params.description:
CF8+ The number of characters to read during each iteration of the loop from the file specified in the file attribute. 
If the value of the characters attribute is more than the number of characters in the file, 
ColdFusion uses the number of characters in the file.

params.name: file
params.description:
CF8+ The absolute path and filename of the text file to read, one line at a time. 
This is helpful when reading large text files, because you can reuse the value of the index variable, 
which contains the current line of the file. 
When the loop completes, ColdFusion closes the file.

params.name: times
params.description: Lucee5+ If you want to have a specific iterations you can simply use `times` param instead of `from` and `to`

examples.title: Loop Over an Array (Script Syntax)
CFLoop over an Array
examples.code:
<cfset myArray = ["a", "b", "c"]> 
 <!--- By index ---> 
 <cfloop index="i" from="1" to="#arrayLen(myArray)#"> 
 <cfoutput>#myArray[i]#</cfoutput> 
 </cfloop> 
 <!--- By array ---> 
 <cfloop index="currentIndex" array="#myArray#"> 
 <cfoutput>#currentIndex#</cfoutput> 
 </cfloop>

examples.title: Loop over a List (Script Syntax)
CFLoop over a List
examples.code:
<!--- Define our list ---> 
 <cfset myList = "a, b, c"> 
 <!--- By list ---> 
 <cfloop index="item" list="#myList#"> 
 <cfoutput>#item#</cfoutput> 
 </cfloop> 
 <!--- By array ---> 
 <cfloop index="currentIndex" array="#listToArray(myList, ",")#"> 
 <cfoutput>#currentIndex#</cfoutput> 
 </cfloop>
